modName: CTD and Freeze Fix Guide - DELETED
summary: A guide on helping solve CTD's and Freezes.
descriptionHtml:
First off this is not a mod there is nothing to download, its a guide to help some
folks like me who had Skyrim constantly crash on them. If this guide
does not work for you perhaps your problem is different in which case
move along.


After much pain staking work I have come to a conclusion about why Skyrim 32-bit suffers from memory leaks.
Lets first examine what is out there, mods that seem to address memory expansion.

The two most useful ones are listed below...

Crash Fixes: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/72725]https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/72725[/url]

SKSE INI File: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51038]https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51038[/url]


You obviously need SKSE to use these two, so what do they do?

It lets you change how much memory to dedicate out, I do not recommend changing the
defaults at all. Skyrim has a hard limit of heap and stack at 512mb containers, the problem
is when both containers are full it leads to an instant CTD.


These mods alone will not save you from crashing, despite whatever else they do.

Then why use at all?

Here is my long journey examined, why my game kept freezing/crashing lead me to
follow how the game works, what I have discovered is that besides your decal settings all
other game settings should be set to medium but before we get to that there is something
else that needs to be done first.

Under your -“C:\Users\*****\Documents\My Games\Skyrim”

Delete or backup both your ini files, get back into Skyrim folder launch the launcher let it
do its thing with the settings. Once done now you can change your settings to medium, also it
might help to disable all reflections and distant lands should also be set to medium.
That is it nothing else needs to be touched.


So why not just hand mod the ini files in the My Games folder?

This is because of the settings the launcher needs to write to those files and set
first through the launcher, after that you can tweak it however you like.


Okay so now you have effectively made your game fugly, no worries, the next step is simple
we will replace all texture maps and terrain and clothing with community built mods. If your using
the official Skyrim texture pack just disable it or do not use it.

Remember this is Skyrim 32-bit always use 2k textures/meshes I have found 4k to lag
the game allot, especially if used on terrain. You can still use 4k
for characters but do not go over board Skyrim Legendary is simply
not designed to handle 4k.

My final analysis the memory in Skyrim Legendary seems to hinge on two major factors which lead to
Freezes or CTD’s, first is the texture problem and second like Oblivion the Skyrim engine
struggles with the default settings set by the launcher that is why you set them to medium.

With texture replacement mods you augment the lack of quality from reduced
settings with detailed surfaces or bump maps that look just as realistic.
This forces the game to stay within the memory bounds, however this is still not the complete picture.

Further study, most mods do not take the Skyrim engines limitations to heart this is
where Crash Fix kicks in. Sometimes you might have Freezes and or CTD despite
having followed this guide. Do not panic, check your (Skyrim > Data > SKSE > Plugins)
folder. Inside you will find a crash report anytime your game CTD’s or Freezes without warning,
majority of the time what caused the problem will be recorded in the crash log found in there.


Turns out some follower and npc mods cause the CTD’s this is probably because,

A) They are using 4k textures.

B) The textures/meshes have been corrupted or are using an older CK tool.

C) Links to or from other mods, that may or may not have bugs.


Avoid using mods like SSME that make use of third party dll files, their basically
forcing the Skyrim engine to do something its not designed for. Which
leads to odd behaviors, took me an hour to discover why my CK would
not work, the dll was interfering with its execution. So be wary of
mods that add extra files to where the Skyrim exe sits.





Hope this helps someone!
author: Hyperquacker
